text: Michael Englmayr (died 1568) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Auxiliary Bishop of Passau (1561–1568)."Bishop Michael Englmayr" Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved July 24, 2016"Diocese of Passau" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Diocese of Passau" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== On 24 Mar 1561, Michael Englmayr was appointed during the papacy of Pope Pius IV as Auxiliary Bishop of Passau and Titular Bishop of Symbalia. He served as Auxiliary Bishop of Passau until his death on 13 Jul 1568. == References == Category:16th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Pius IV Category:1568 deaths
title: Michael Englmayr
